intro: Espostoa ulei, commonly known as the oil plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It produces a unique type of seed oil, which has been used traditionally for various purposes. Due to its ecological and economic significance, it is also of interest for conservation and agricultural research.
